Message.Title: Big brother gaming/How I learned to shut up and love msft sony
Message.Msg: The latest updates from Microsoft regarding the Xbox One have confirmed that users will be unable to play games for more than 24 hours without connecting to the internet, and that it will be games publishers who will decide whether consumers can resell titles. Anyone who buys an xbox or playstation will forever be known as "stupid sheep". The only game console to purchase is (call it what it is) Shield!

Message.Title: QCOM declined significantly on leaked information
Message.Msg: From Samsung Galaxy S4 component suppliers.... That Sammy has reduced orders on lowered forecasts of S4 sales - in-line for the launch quarter, but lower for subsequent quarters and SIGNIFICANTLY lower for the 'peak months" sales.

Topic.Title: QCOM declined significantly on leaked information

Message.Msg: ibexx, do you think it's due to a glut or pricing? Perhaps Samsung just over estimated how often the market would replace their current phone?
Do you still feel strong about it? Today things are reversed. Why not WMC or NYMT instead?
AGNC has a Brilliant CEO that is managing a hedge fund that will get you the dividend no matter the direction of the market.

Topic.Title: QCOM declined significantly on leaked information

Message.Msg: Apparently, consumers do not feel that S4 is superior to S3 by a sufficiently large margin, hence not worth the cost and effort to uprade it. (Some gimmicks, yes, but no substantial upgrade in substance). Samsung runs the danger of putting its products for the sheer purpose of making money - like Apple, a badaSS capitalist - and the Galaxy line of phones and tablets are getting less illuminating by generations. Samsung still sells by aggressive marketing and relies on its legacy, but things could change quickly in the competitive landscape - Samsung Galaxy Note 3 will run on S800, good luck there considering the competition of HP Slatebook x2, ASUS transformer pad infiinity etc....just one of the numerous examples. Note that Samsung's much touted Nexus 10 has been lack-luster in terms of consumer acceptance, as compared to the wildly populy N7.

Topic.Title: Bloomberg: Samsung falls after JPMorgan cuts Galaxy S4 estimates

Message.Msg: The whole point of posting Samsung S4 information is that, at some point in the future, if Samsung feels its products are vulnerable due to lack of innovation, Sammy will be smart enough to come back to NVIDIA as a customer and partner. The sooner the better.

Topic.Title: Bloomberg: Samsung falls after JPMorgan cuts Galaxy S4 estimates

Message.Msg: 'if Samsung feels its products are vulnerable due to lack of innovation, Sammy will be smart enough to come back to NVIDIA as a customer and partner. The sooner the better.' What unique innovation can Nvidia provide that others can't ? If Nvidia had bothered to update Tegra 3 on 28nm like it once said it would on slides it might have had a good chance of stopping the Samsung Galaxy Tab win of Clovertrail+ but now there is a long time gap until Tegra 4i can compete for low power low price slots. The Tegra team is not good at anticipating future competition and designing their skus accordingly which is probably why the heads of that dept keep getting fired.

Message.Title: ZDNet: Intel's Computex honeymoon unlikely to last.
Message.Msg: As the barrage of processor news from Intel this week at Computex fades, the reality of a commoditized semiconductor market will again start to hit home. Piper Jaffray analyst Auguste Gus Richard, who has been critical of Intel's business model and mobile prospects, cut his estimates, rating, and price target on the company's shares. The big problem: The PC market forecast as well as ARM, which will at the very least ensure Intel makes little money on the mobile front. Intel's Haswell and Silvermont platforms are promising, but only go so far. Richard said: We are lowering our PC forecast (down 6.9 percent in 2013 from down 2.9 percent) and believe current demand is channel fill. Tablets and smartphones, other components and capabilities (displays, cameras, apps etc.) are taking attention and dollars away from the CPU. Additionally, an army of ARM-based suppliers have come to market commoditizing the processor market. Leading smartphone and tablet vendors are also using internally-designed ARM-based CPUs and now low-end CPUs are available for as little as $4. Richard noted Intel's Silvermont platform, a new Atom architecture aimed at ARM, will hurt Haswell more than it does ARM. Overall, Intel will see lower profit margins. Richard noted: Richard noted Intel's Silvermont platform, a new Atom architecture aimed at ARM, will hurt Haswell more than it does ARM. Overall, Intel will see lower profit margins. Richard noted: Haswell will no doubt improve battery life and Windows Blue or 8.1 will be an improvement over Windows 8. We don't think it is enough though. These efforts are likely to be too late in the year to drive real growth in PCs in CY13 or 1H:14. We expect to continue to see tablets taking shares from notebooks with the desktop market remaining stagnate. While Intel will gain a toehold in the tablet market with Silvermont, it is likely at the expense of notebook sales. SOURCE: zdnetDOTcom/intels-computex-honeymoon-unlikely-to-last-says-analyst-700001653

Topic.Title: ZDNet: Intel's Computex honeymoon unlikely to last.

Message.Msg: If any of that BS was remotely true Nvidia would be in trouble as it is highly dependent on high spec PCs for its profitable businesses like a baby suckling on its mother. Virtually all the so called PC decline recently though can be attributed to netbooks going out of fashion and as they really were a tablet form factor all along should not have been lumped in with the PC category in the first place. Silvermont will have no effect on Haswell as those who want high performing processors will continue to buy them and those who want high endurance processors will continue to buy them. There are 2 Haswells which have a 11.5W TDP and 6w SDP which will kill Tegra 4s as will quad-core Baytrails, users will be spoiled for choice which ARM-crushing x86 processor they can buy and each will equally add to Intel's bottom line as it is only the old 32nm Atoms which are being given away to get marketshare.
but AGNC had a very ugly 1Q report. They still have to earn money to pay the divi.
